value.title: The coming weeks will define Biden's presidency and shape the midterm elections
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden must define the politics of this fall before they define him, as he seeks to re-establish the authority of an administration that often appeared overtaken by a relentless summer of challenges.

value.title: As Donald Trump makes noise about 2024, Melania Trump tries to stay out of the public eye
value.excerpt: As Donald Trump publicly mulls his political future, playing a game of "will he-won't he" in a potential bid for the White House in 2024, all the while flexing influence in primaries for next year's midterms, there is one key person noticeably quiet. Again.

value.title: Biden promised ISIS-K will 'pay.' Having no US troops in Afghanistan makes that harder
value.excerpt: As the Biden administration grapples with the challenge of carrying out counterterrorism missions in Afghanistan without US boots on the ground, CNN has learned new details about last Sunday's drone strike on suspected ISIS-K fighters in Kabul that some officials say provide insight into the obstacles

value.title: Biden to travel to New York, Pennsylvania, and Virginia to mark 20th anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attacks
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden will travel to all three sites of the 9/11 terrorist attacks next Saturday, marking the 20th anniversary of the deadly day, the White House said in a statement Saturday.

value.title: Kamala Harris to campaign with Gavin Newsom in final stretch before California recall election
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris will campaign with California Gov. Gavin Newsom in the Bay Area Wednesday, according to a source familiar with the plans.

value.title: January 6 select committee refutes claim by McCarthy that the Justice Department cleared Trump of any role in insurrection
value.excerpt: The top members of the select committee investigating the January 6 riot on Capitol Hill refuted recent claims by House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy that former President Donald Trump has been cleared by the Justice Department of any role in the insurrection.

value.title: Biden administration's Sept. 20 booster rollout may be scaled back to just Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine at first
value.excerpt: There have been internal conversations within the Biden administration about scaling back the ambitious booster plan laid out by top federal health officials last month as the calendar nears September 20, the date when booster shots may start to be offered.

value.title: Fact check: Biden spoke to Tree of Life rabbi, but his claim about visiting the synagogue is false
value.excerpt: In public remarks on Thursday to Jewish leaders in advance of the High Holy Days, President Joe Biden spoke at length about the "scourge of anti-Semitism."

value.title: Biden orders a declassification review of documents related to September 11 attacks
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Friday signed an executive order directing the Department of Justice and other federal agencies to conduct a declassification review related to the FBI's investigation of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

value.title: Biden taps former Delaware governor to lead Afghan resettlement efforts in US
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden has tapped former Delaware Gov. Jack Markell as the temporary point person who will oversee the administration's Afghan evacuee resettlement effort in the United States, the White House announced Friday.

value.title: Trump administration deliberately slowed entry of Afghan allies
value.excerpt: Stephen Miller seemed floored by the idea, raised during a fall Cabinet meeting in 2018, of  keeping open the doors for Afghan allies and other Middle East refugees to enter the US.

value.title: Biden says Texas' anti-abortion law is 'almost un-American' and 'sort of creates a vigilante system'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden said Friday the Texas state law that bans abortion after as early as six weeks into pregnancy is "almost un-American," pointing specifically to a provision allowing individuals to take civil action against people who help a woman get an abortion.

value.title: Biden set to travel to Louisiana to survey damage from Hurricane Ida
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden is headed to Louisiana on Friday to survey damage from Hurricane Ida, after almost a week of the deadly storm ravaging the eastern half of the United States.

value.title: Manchin upends Democrats' push to enact Biden's agenda this month, calling for 'pause' on $3.5 trillion bill
value.excerpt: Sen. Joe Manchin, the most pivotal Democratic swing vote in the Senate, threw a major wrench in his party's carefully crafted plans to pass a massive $3.5 trillion bill by month's end, demanding they take a "strategic pause" before considering a sweeping bill to implement much of President Joe Biden's

value.title: Another Trump Organization executive to appear before NY grand jury as prosecutors probe former President's business
value.excerpt: The Trump Organization's corporate director of security is expected to appear before a grand jury on Thursday in Manhattan, where prosecutors are investigating former President Donald Trump's business, according to a person familiar with the matter.

value.title: Trump endorses Parnell in Pennsylvania Senate race
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump waded into Pennsylvania's US Senate race on Wednesday, endorsing Sean Parnell, an Army veteran and former congressional candidate, in the competitive Republican primary.

value.title: McConnell: 'There isn't going to be an impeachment' of Biden
value.excerpt: Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell said Wednesday that "there isn't going to be an impeachment" of President Joe Biden over the withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan, noting that Democrats control the House and Senate.

value.title: New additions to Tom Barrack's legal team signal former Trump adviser will fight DOJ's charges
value.excerpt: Two prominent New York defense attorneys have joined the legal team for Tom Barrack, the former adviser to then-President Donald Trump who is now facing federal foreign lobbying charges.

value.title: House Republicans point fingers at Biden moments after Kabul blasts
value.excerpt: Republicans in Congress quickly escalated their criticism of President Joe Biden's withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan after two explosions outside Kabul's airport on Thursday caused the first American casualties since the mass evacuation began.

value.title: Judge sanctions pro-Trump lawyers who brought 'frivolous' election fraud lawsuits
value.excerpt: A federal judge ordered sanctions Wednesday for Sidney Powell, Lin Wood and several other lawyers who worked on Trump-aligned lawsuits seeking to challenge the results of the 2020 election.

value.title: Fact checking Jake Sullivan's claim Trump admin didn't process Afghan visas for a year
value.excerpt: During a press briefing Monday, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan suggested a slowdown in approvals for the Afghan Special Immigrant Visa (SIV) program during the Trump administration contributed to the current delays in evacuating Afghans.

value.title: Biden looks for air-clearing in first meeting with Israel's new leader
value.excerpt: When Israel's prime minister visits the White House on Thursday, for the first time in 12 years, it will be someone other than Benjamin Netanyahu.

value.title: Climate measures in reconciliation, infrastructure bills will mostly meet Biden's emissions goals, Schumer says
value.excerpt: An analysis from Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer's office estimates that combined, the bipartisan infrastructure bill and $3.5 trillion budget reconciliation bill can meet the majority of President Joe Biden's target to drastically slash emissions by the end of the decade.

value.title: With cases in Florida surging, DeSantis and Biden square off over coronavirus response
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis have found their chosen rhetorical rivals in the fight against the coronavirus: each other. And neither seems eager to back down anytime soon.

value.title: SCOTUS gave Trump leeway on executive actions. Biden wants the same treatment
value.excerpt: The Biden administration faces two major confrontations with the Supreme Court this week, as the justices weigh requests related to the Covid moratorium on evictions and the termination of a Trump practice that forced migrants seeking US asylum to stay in Mexico until their claims could be heard.

value.title: Possible Havana syndrome incident delayed Harris flight to Vietnam
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris' departure for Vietnam was delayed by several hours Tuesday afternoon after her office was informed by the US embassy in Hanoi, Vietnam, of a "report of a recent possible anomalous health incident."

value.title: Hostile Trump mob sends GOP Rep. Brooks into panicked backpedal on moving on from 2020
value.excerpt: Rachel Maddow shares video of Republican Congressman Mo Brooks being roundly booed by the audience at a Donald Trump rally in Alabama after Brooks suggested they move on from Trump's 2020 loss and focus on future elections.

value.title: Why is Joe Biden suing Facebook and Instagram over vaccine posts?
value.excerpt: Facebook is back in hot water after an explosive New York Times investigative report found the company hid the truth about its most popular viral content after the company discovered the most-viewed link on the platform raised doubt about the coronavirus vaccine.

value.title: Biden praises WNBA champion Seattle Storm for their work on and off the court during White House visit
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden honored the WNBA champion Seattle Storm at the White House Monday, praising the team for its actions both on and off the court -- especially work the team has done on social justice issues.

value.title: Afghanistan fallout engulfs Harris' first day of Southeast Asia trip
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris, undertaking a suddenly high-stakes visit to Southeast Asia this week amid the first major foreign policy crisis of the Biden administration, was on the receiving end of questions Monday about the US' withdrawal from Afghanistan for the first time since the chaotic fall of
